meanings.definition: To score more points than an opponent in a game or competition.
meanings.sent1: The team was outscoring their rivals in every match.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys outscoring her friends in board games.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be outscoring the dog in the race to the food bowl.
meanings.sent4: The sun was outscoring the clouds in the battle for the sky.
meanings.sent5: Outscoring the competition became their ultimate goal.

meanings.sent1: He outscored his previous record by a large margin.
meanings.sent2: The new player quickly outscored the veteran on the team.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel managed to outscore the birds in gathering nuts.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outscore her limitations was inspiring.
meanings.sent5: Outscoring expectations, she achieved great success.
